questions.question_text:
A desktop administrator just connected a printer to a workstation, but the workstation does not recognize the printer. Which of the following does the workstation
MOST likely need for the printer to function?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Off-site storage

Off-site storage is the best means of preventing data loss in the event of a disaster. By keeping backups of data at a different location, you ensure that even if the primary site is completely compromised, the data remains safe and can be restored.

questions.question_text: Which of the following would provide the BEST means of preventing data loss in the event of a disaster?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Pre-installed applications are reporting user information.

Many new computers come with pre-installed software (often referred to as bloatware or junkware) that may collect and send user information back to the manufacturer or third parties. These applications might run in the background and generate outbound network traffic, especially after the initial setup when the user agrees to terms and conditions without reviewing them. This can include reporting hardware usage, software updates, or even usage statistics.

Selected Answer: A
Its A. Many new desktop computers come with pre-installed software or bloatware that can automatically connect to the internet to send user data or report system information back to the manufacturer or third-party companies. This kind of behavior often includes tracking, system analytics, or advertisements. Since the user accepted all the default prompts during setup, it’s possible these applications were not disabled and are sending outbound traffic without the user’s direct knowledge.

It's not B because this is usually a one-time process and would not explain ongoing outbound traffic unless explicitly stated by the system.

Selected Answer: A
A. Pre-installed applications are reporting user information.
Many new computers come with pre-installed applications (bloatware) that may automatically send usage statistics, diagnostic data, or other information back to the vendor or third-party developers. This activity often begins immediately after setup.

Selected Answer: B
B. Applications are retrieving the latest security configuration changes.

New computers often come with pre-installed software that automatically checks for and downloads updates once the computer is set up and connected to the internet. These updates can include security patches, software updates, and system drivers, which are essential for the secure and efficient operation of the system. It is common and expected behavior for a new system to reach out to update servers to ensure all software is current.

comments.content: The question says tho that the user notices outbound traffic meaning its going from the computer, not to the computer, so its A. Everything you are describing is inbound.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The keyword is "outbound network traffic". The only correct answer is A.

questions.question_text: A home user has recently purchased a new desktop computer. After following the prompts during setup and accepting all defaults, the user has noticed outbound network traffic. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?

choices.B: Applications are retrieving the latest security configuration changes.
choices.A: Pre-installed applications are reporting user information.
choices.C: Group Policy objects are being implemented.

questions.question_text: A development team is brainstorming how a new program should operate. Which of the following techniques can be used to depict the program visually during brainstorming?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Flowchart.

A flowchart is a graphical representation that is commonly used during brainstorming sessions to visually depict the flow of a program, process, or system. It uses various shapes (like rectangles, diamonds, and ovals) to represent different steps or decisions and arrows to show the flow of the process. This helps developers quickly visualize how a program should operate.

questions.question_text: Data contained on which of the following would have the HIGHEST expectation of privacy?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Laptop.

A laptop typically has the highest expectation of privacy among the options listed, as it is a personal device that is often used by an individual to store sensitive information. It is physically portable, and its data is usually only accessible by the owner or authorized users. Unless the laptop is specifically connected to a network or cloud service, the data on it may not be as readily accessible to others, giving it a higher expectation of privacy.

Selected Answer: A
A. Mobile
Data on mobile devices typically carries the highest expectation of privacy due to the personal nature of the device. Mobile devices often store private communications (texts, calls), personal photos, social media activity, and other sensitive information tied to an individual.

Selected Answer: A
Mobile phones are most secure as they are your personal device. Laptops and Workstations could be owned by a company. The Cloud is mostly a company based thing as well.

B is just wrong. No question.
Its either C or D. Id go with Workstation
